poem:
**Drone Sightings Over Munich**

A buzz in the sky, unseen  
yet heard, pauses flights,   
a new migratory bird—   
not bound by seasons or seas,  
but by signals and whims.  
Markus sees them as intruders,  
calling for the hawk-eyed police  
to bring down these modern marionettes,  
so that wings may once again navigate  
the undisturbed air.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Calls for police to shoot down drones after Munich airport disruption – as it happened 3.45pm BST Closing summary … and on that note, it’s a wrap! Senior German politicians called for a stronger reaction to drone sightings over European airports, with Bavarian PM Markus Söder urging police to shoot them down (10:57) after overnight disruptions at Munich airport (9:55). Related: Munich airport reopens after halting flights because of drone sightings Drone sightings will be". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
